articles.description: Tractor Supply Company is set to open its Roseburg store in March, with a soft opening planned for March 21 and a grand opening on March 28. The store will be located in North Roseburg Plaza and is expected to create about 15 local jobs.
articles.title: Tractor Supply on Track to Open Roseburg Store in March

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A 33 year old Roseburg man was arrested after police say he displayed a knife and demanded money from an employee at a Del Taco, later claiming he was joking. The employee asked him to leave, and officers later arrested the man, who also admitted to an earlier theft.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Arrested After Knife “Joke” at Del Taco

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Saving Grace Humane Society announced that 17 dogs seized in August of 2025 with assistance from Roseburg police and Douglas County Animal Control are now available for adoption. The dogs spent several months receiving medical care and socialization and are ready for placement.
articles.title: Saving Grace Humane Society Announces 17 Seized Dogs Now Available for Adoption

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Mayor Larry Rich will deliver the city’s 2026 State of the City address at 7 p.m. Monday, Jan. 12, during the first City Council meeting of the year at City Hall. The presentation will also be streamed live online.
articles.title: Roseburg Mayor to Deliver 2026 State of the City Address Jan. 12

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Winston man was arrested early Thursday after allegedly attempting to elude police during a traffic stop. Officers pursued the vehicle from Main Street and Brosi Orchard Road to Highway 42 and Brockway Road before taking the driver into custody.
articles.title: Winston Man Arrested After Attempted Elude Early Thursday Morning

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A two-day Amateur Radio General License class will be held Feb. 14–15, 2026, at the Glide Fire Station. The General license is the second FCC license level and requires a current Technician license to upgrade.
articles.title: Two-Day Ham Radio General License Class Scheduled in Glide

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County commissioners approved a renewed $1.9 million state grant to support the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team through August 2027. The funding will support investigations and enforcement related to illegal marijuana operations, according to county officials.
articles.title: Commissioners Approve Drug Enforcement Grant for Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations Jan. 8, including a robbery investigation, a downtown exclusion zone trespass, and a drinking in public violation. Several individuals were lodged at Douglas County Corrections, according to police logs.
articles.title: Police Log: January 8, 2026

articles.description: Roseburg Parks and Recreation will launch the Discover Roseburg 15 Land of Umpqua Geocache Series with a free public kickoff Saturday, Feb. 7, from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. at the Roseburg Public Library. The challenge includes 20 geocache locations across the city.
articles.title: Roseburg Parks and Recreation to Launch Discover Roseburg 15 Geocache Series Feb. 7
